headline: Easy Pizza Sauce
description: An easy pizza sauce that doesn't require cooking so it's quick to make and tastes fresh and delicious. Mix tomato sauce with seasoning and it's ready.

video.description: This no-cook pizza sauce tastes just like the best takeout.
video.name: Easy Pizza Sauce III

name: Easy Pizza Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together tomato sauce and tomato paste in a medium bowl until smooth.
Stir in oregano, garlic, and paprika to pizza sauce mixture.

review.reviewBody: My opinion only....... The fresh/cooked argument for the difference between the 2 sauces doesn't hold. Aren't those canned tomato products 'cooked' in the canning process? ...... & the umami that deepens the flavor of pizza sauce is a bit of anchovy or its oils..... doubly necessary in this day of flavorless cheeses.

This was a really good pizza sauce. I live in Pittsburgh, PA, and we have an Italian store called Delallo's. This sauce is as good or better than Delallo's. Thanks for the recipe. I made my crust following https://sugarspunrun.com/the-best-pizza-dough-recipe/ Amazing pizza.
I tweaked it a bit but it's very good and fast and also a lot thriftier than purchasing premixed sauce.

WOW...that was sooooo easy, but it needed some "oomph". The original recipe was on the bland side and too thick for spreading. Used "diced" tomatoes that had been seasoned w/ basil, garlic, and oregano, "real" garlic instead of dry, "Italian seasoning" instead of just oregano, and liberally tossed in some grated romano. DEE-LISH-US!!! CALORIES: 4 servings = 300 1 serving = 75
It’s pretty easy but instead of dried minced garlic I used garlic powder. Still came out great.
Simple to make. No exotic ingrediants ! Very tasty.

Had to tweak so much it wasn't even near the original recipe. Quite confused on why this is rated so high. I added crushed red pepper, Basil, salt, pepper, onion Powder, farlic powder, and switched out fresh garlic
I made this sauce but found the sauce was a bit tart. I will try again with some changes.

Good but feels like it's missing something.

When you make this, let it sit in the fridge for a little while so the flavors can fully extract into the tomatoe.

Super delicious and easy. Made extra to freeze. Added additions after reading some recommendations by other cooks. 1/2 tsp of sugar, 2 tsp of oregano, 1 tsp of onion powder, 1 tsp of basil, used garlic powder instead of dried garlic.

It was okay for a last minute meal when I realized my pantry was almost empty, and no Italian water left.

I did use tomato puree instead of paste and tom sauce. Also, I added some onion powder and garlic powder instead of fresh garlic (I didn't think the raw garlic would cook before the pizza was done... and I hate raw garlic.

I can say I've made worse pizza sauce in my time, and this is one I'll keep on hand for another emergency should it happen.

Oh, and I do think cooking it at a slow simmer for a bit would improve it a lot.
I've searched everywhere for a good pizza sauce, this is fabulous.
Add a little sugar, and this is the best sauce I ever tasted.
Excellent with or without the tweeks.
I thought this recipe was really good! I liked that I didn't need a lot of ingredients and no cooking!
I added basil! No sugar. It’s awesome!
It’s great for pizza
Excellent!! Sorry but I added a little sugar and chopped fresh basil...first time I’ve ever made a sauce that wasn’t cooked on stove- it was amazing!
Great sauce. Wow. Loved it and easy to adjust based on preference and what is on hand without changing the basic recipe.

I was in the middle of making homemade pizza when I realized I didn't have any pizza sauce. I turned to this recipe in a hurry. It is an excellent base recipe. I used tomato puree instead of sauce, because that's what I had on hand. I used the Gluten-Free Pizza Crust recipe also found on here, along with mozzarella cheese and sliced salami. Yum!
So easy and tasted good!!
Loved it! Added sugar, basil.
perfect and easy. I didn't have tomato paste, so I just reduced it and added 1/2 tsp of olive oil
horible the worst ever

Our family really liked this when my wife and I made it; a definite improvement over the usual store-bought sauces. However, because I was making enough dough for two 10 x 15 sheet pizzas, have a wife that loves margherita pizza and needed to make enough to cover both, I added a partially-drained 15 oz can of petite diced tomatoes and increased the seasoning. Ultimately, I used approximately 4 teaspoons of oregano and 2-1/2 teaspoons of dried minced garlic, then added approximately 1-1/2 teaspoons of basil and 1-1/2 teaspoons of Italian seasoning along with the original teaspoon of paprika. I warmed the mixture in a sauce pan, while waiting for the pizza dough, to help develop and test the flavor. Everyone enjoyed the flavorful, chunky sauce. I'm including a photo of the final results, specifically my daughters vegan style pizza, made with the sauce and pizza toppings that include a pepper & onion medley, plant-based meatballs / crumbles, non-dairy cheese and pineapple.

I added 1/2Tbs basil, 1/2tsp sugar Just popped In the oven and my pizza was delish. Topped with cooked mild Italian sausage, onion, green pepper, and lots of cheese. I like to combine mozzarella and Romano. Will use this sauce again!

This is my very first time making pizza sauce, I doubled the recipe because I didn't have any sauce and had to use a 28 oz can of crushed tomatoes which I didn't mind because the taste is the same,, just giving a thicker texture, I also followed another reviewer, Donnie, and added the 1 tsp of sugar and 3 tsp of dried Basil total. My husband was very pleased, we both loved it, I wrote this down immediately so I don't forget how i did anything, we will be using this as our go to sauce recipe from now on! We're very happy with this recipe!!!! Thanks for sharing it!!

This was amazingly easy and simply. I love the fact that it doesn't require cooking. This recipe makes quite a bit. The extra kept well in the fridge for a few weeks. Of course it would freeze well. Instead of sugar to cut the acidity, I used a tsp of baking soda. Did the trick. I will definitely be using this as my go to pizza sauce recipe!
This pizza sauce is super easy and so flavorful. I will definitely make it again!

A wonderful combination, makes a rich and thick sauce we all love. I use fresh garlic not dried and more like 2 heaping teaspoons (but we love garlic) and also add a good heaping tablespoon and a 1/2 of dried basil. (Update: watch the amount of paprika you use, I had discovered Penzy's half sharp paprika and decided to use it in the recipe... Even though I decreased the amount by 1/3 knowing it was strong, it overwhelmed the sauce. I remember that happened another time with a fresher more flavor forward paprika I had tried. So beware of the amount of paprika.)
I agree with adding 1/2 Tbsp basil, 1/2 tsp sugar and 1/2 tsp onion powder.

I have used this recipe now for a long time. It’s my go to recipe and I have it memorized. I was looking for something more authentic than a jar of pasta sauce and this is it. The only difference is that I add some salt and pepper to taste. People seem to rave about my pizzas.

With a little tweeking this is my favorite sauce by far after trying many recipes. 
 I used 1 tbs of fresh garlic instead of dried, changed Oregano to 2 tsp, added 1/2 tsp Sugar, 2 tsp Basil, and 1tbs of grated parmesan. Perfecto!
Easy sauce. Bland. I added smoked onion powder, garlic powder italian seasonings, salt and pepper. Better flavor. I will make again with my additions
This was absolutely one of the easiest pizza sauce recipes I have ever made. I highly recommend it and you can add extra spices to make it to your taste. Bon appétit?

I used another users suggestion of adding basil, sugar, onion powder, but then I heated mine on the stove to allow the flavors to heat up together. I'm pleased with it! I will make some others just to see what one I like best, but this is a positive start.

This pizza sauce was amazing. As someone who has never made pizza before this was a very easy recipe and tasted very good. It does not take long to cook and a great pizza sauce that tastes great with pepperoni and cheese.
Amazingly simple to prepare and VERY tasty. No more store bought pizza sauce for our family!
This is a great pizza sauce. I am Keto, so I use large portabello mushrooms instead of pizza crust.
This a great sauce.
Add chili pepper seasoning to make it spicy
We are retired so didn't need that much sauce for one 9" pizza I did not add the tomato sauce. I added 1/2-3/4 can of water to the tomato paste. I did add all the spices but cut back on them too.
Bit sweet, may try upping the spices next time
I always add my own twist w/ herbs. So basil, a little brown sugar, & just a splash of Suracha sauce! It was wonderful!
Delicious! Perfect!
Awesome simple and tasty! It was a snow day project and the only thing missing was pizza sauce. Came out great
After reading all the rave reviews I couldn't wait to try this. Unfortunately I'll be continuing my search, as this isn't the pizza sauce of our dreams. :(
It was ok for an uncooked sauce, however I like my sauce a bit on the sweet side, so might add some sugar next time.

I added 1/2 tsp of basil, marjoram, oregano and onion powder and cayenne powder. I used 2 tbsp of honey instead of sugar. Used 2 fresh minced garlic cloves and 1/2 tsp salt. Tastes great. Start with 1 tbs of honey and go from there. I like 2 because when you start piling on the cheese and other salty toppings it makes for a great balance.

This recipe definitely suited our needs for making a Spaghetti Squash Pizza Pie, but we had to make changes as it seemed the amount of oregano was going to be way too much. Reduced the amount of oregano to 1-1.5 tsp and added about 1 tsp basil. Definitely fast and easy to make, but needs some minor tweaks.
The flavor was a bit strong. I doubled the recipe, not sure if that had anything to do with it. My teenage daughter threw out her dinner.

First time making homemade pizza sauce, and your recipe was a great help! Thanks for sharing. I ended up adding onion powder, and cayenne as your recipe didn't quite have the flavor I was looking for. Next time I will also add some fresh basil.

I follow this recipe loosely. It's helpful to taste and adjust the seasonings as you go. I usually add a little sugar also. I have also replaced the sauce with diced tomatoes that are blended with an immersion blender. Really good!
Easy and delish!
Easy peasy and tasted great! I used half for pizza night and froze the other half (ended up using it for pasta night).
loved it! i two tweaked it as Sonnie suggested. 2 tsp Basil and 1/2 tsp white sugar.
I added some parmesan cheese to the sauce. It was good. It was easy. Next time I would probably add a little basil and onion powder.
Delicious. Made a wonderful pizza.
Made it exactly as written. Amazing and simple. (I did add chopped fresh basil and a sprinkling of red pepper flakes to the pizza itself.... but the sauce was brilliant).
very nice, tasty and easy.

This was super easy and tasted great! I only had part of a can of paste in the fridge so I used what I had and added 1 tsp of cornstarch to the sauce to help thicken it up. I had Penzey's Italian seasoning on hand so added 2 tsps of that rather than play with the oregano/basil ratio others recommended. We will definitely be using this recipe again.
Followed this recipes exactly as written , it was delicious and I wouldn’t change a thing. I used it for 2 thin crust pizzas and I had plenty left over.
This is quick and easy. It makes enough for 3 pizzas. I added more oregano bc we like it.
It was fast and easy to make.
very yummy. made the changes other had made and my family loved it.
Not right. not pizza sauce
This is a awesome easy recipe I use it alot

I only did it with the tomato paste the smallest can, paprika and basil. Paprika gives the spicy touch to the pizza sauce, without being too spicy making it delicious. No need of cooking makes it so much easier. It was enough for 5-6 medium pita breads. Top it with mozarella, then peperoni, grape tomatoes and any other desired ingredient. Healthy homemade recipe. Enjoy

I made this when my kids requested homemade pizza and I didn’t have a can of pizza sauce in the cupboard. It was so easy with simple ingredients and delicious. It made enough to cover two 12-inch pizzas. Highly recommend!
Worst sauce I've ever had. To much garlic and entirely too much oregano.
Simple, tasty, quick and did the job. Will use again!

Easy and excellent! I had some leftover so I used it to dip breadsticks in and it was so good. I did use the tip of adding a little sugar and onion powder. Will definitely be using this for now on. Thanks for sharing!
Love this sauce, I did use one fresh steamed tomato ( peeled) and Tomato paste. Fresh Garlic instead of dried. I would recommend this recipe !!!
EXCELLENT! Super easy. I added a little sugar.
Everyone's saying they modified it.. but I thought it was perfect... whipped it up in 2 minutes, tastes great... cant wait to try it on my pizza tonight!

Super easy. Consistency on the thinner side of pizza sauce which we prefer. (But I used fresh tomato sauce from our fresh tomato strainer so our tomato sauce was more runny to start with). Smells good. Kids like it.
Really good, especially for how easy it is.
My husband liked this sauce very much and that's pretty much all that mattered to me. Made it just like it's written.

This was easy and tasted great! When I first tasted the sauce before going on the pizza on it's own, I thought the flavor was a little too strong, but the final product on the pizza, was great and robust. Will definitely make again!
Nice and simple! Tasted great
I decided to make pizza last minute the other night when I found this recipe. It is so easy and so good! I don't think I'll ever buy pizza sauce again!
This is a very good pizza sauce recipe. I used it a few times and the second time I used granulated garlic instead. Turns out perfect either way.
it was so good I ate the sauce alone
Super easy! Added 1 tsp olive oil and a little salt. This is a keeper. Thanks!
It's easy and looks good, but it's way too sweet and tastes of tomato sauce- do you know what I mean - that odd canned tomato sauce taste?
Great sauce. Way better than store bought and very easy to make.
Made it just the way it says it's amazing!!!
I should have read other people's reviews so I could have added Extra things. The recipe itself is not good , it lacks flavor and it's too pasty.
I made it as the recipe states and it was amazing!
Great recipe

This is so good, and is so easy to make! I've now made it twice. I did add a little bit of basil and a two cloves of garlic, and ended up adding a little sugar, as well. Thank you for a wonderful recipe! My whole family loves it.
With Deed330's suggestions this is my new go to sauce for pizza's and as a base for spag bol ;)

It was really good. I added 1/2 tsp of onion powder and 1/2 tsp of sugar to cut the tomato paste. Also added 1tsp of crushed red pepper because we like the spice. My mom loved it and she is not a fan of pizza!

I didn't like this pizza sauce. I thought it was very bland and tasted more like pasta sauce. I added 1/2Tbs basil, 1 tsp sugar and 1/2 tsp onion powder like another reviewer suggested and more garlic, plus salt and pepper and it didn't really taste any better. I won't make it again. Hopefully I can find another recipe to suite my tastes. Also, this made enough for two 16 inch (large) pizzas.

I heated mine through while I preheated the crust (about 5 min). The paprika added just the right amount of sweetness to the sauce. I've tried soooo many different sauces from scratch over the years, but this will be my go-to until summer tomatoes are back!

Perfectly easy and delicious before I tweaked it. Sauteed some spinach in olive oil. Used the immersion blender to blend it in and hide it from the kids. Too much will turn the sauce brown but I figure a little spinach is better than none!
Excellent. I did use 1/2 Tbs Basil, 1/2 tsp sugar and 1/2 tsp onion powder
I will make this again for sure. Would not change a thing. Wondering how it would be on spaghetti??
Very simple and good.
